conclusion: Principles of shadow formation affect shadow size and position.
Objects are an alarm clock, an egg, and a rectangular box; shadows are labeled A, B, C, and D.
Light source position affects shadow size and position.
Moving light source to back left or right shifts shadow position.
Shadow size changes with relative size of objects and light source.
Shadows move closer to or further from light source; size changes accordingly.
Shadows move closer to or further from light source; size changes proportionally to objects.
Final answer: Shadows move closer to or further from light source; size changes proportionally to objects.
